greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(n,k) is the number of series-reduced rooted trees with n leaves of k colors.
comment: Not all colors need to be used.
See table 2.3 in the Johnson reference.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275
V. P. Johnson, Enumeration Results on Leaf Labeled Trees, Ph. D. Dissertation, Univ. Southern Calif., 2012.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, `if`(i<1, 0,
add(binomial(A(i, k)+j-1, j)*b(n-i*j, i-1, k), j=0..n/i)))
seq(seq(A(n, 1+d-n), n=1..d), d=1..12);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 17 2018
mathematica: b[n_, i_, k_] := b[n, i, k] = If[n == 0, 1, If[i < 1, 0, Sum[Binomial[A[i, k] + j - 1, j] b[n - i j, i - 1, k], {j, 0, n/i}]]];
Table[A[n, 1 + d - n], {d, 1, 12}, {n, 1, d}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 11 2019, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
program: (PARI) \\ here R(n,k) gives k'th column as a vector.
R(n,k)={my(v=[k]); for(n=2, n, v=concat(v, EulerT(concat(v,[0]))[n])); v}
{my(T=Mat(vector(8, k, R(8, k)~))); for(n=1, #T~, print(T[n,]))} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 15 2018
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 15 2018
